intro: Cyananthus hookeri var. hispidus, commonly known as the hispid cyananthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color, and it is noted for its ornamental value in alpine gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
